title: Earthquake
overview: An earthquake is the shaking of the surface of the Earth resulting from a sudden release of energy.
tips: Stay away from windows and heavy objects.
After shaking stops, evacuate carefully using stairs.
response: Check for injuries and hazards (gas leaks, electric lines).
Expect aftershocks and be ready to Drop, Cover, and Hold On again.

title: Flood
overview: Floods are high water levels that submerge land that's usually dry.
tips: Avoid walking or driving through flood waters.
response: Listen to local alerts and updates.
Boil or treat water before drinking.
Document damage for insurance and aid.

title: Wildfire / Fire
overview: Fires can spread quickly and produce dangerous smoke.
tips: Stay low to avoid smoke; cover nose and mouth.
Have an evacuation plan and kit ready.
response: Evacuate if instructed; keep doors closed.
Call emergency services from a safe location.
Treat minor burns; seek medical care for serious injuries.
